cell.p:
This Company's system of submarine telegraph
cables is the most direct and quickest means of
communication from Egypt to Europe, North and
South America, East, South and West Africa,
India, Australia, New Zealand, China and Japan.

To secure quick transmission, telegrams should
be marked Via Eastern.

For latest average time to London, see daily
bulletin in this paper.

weakness in the step they had taken. The Russian Government first accedes to a most important political step and then at the last moment withdraws ite sanction. But instead of putting an absolute veto on the conference it allows the representatives of the Zemstvos to meet in private. The consequences were obvious Radical resolutions are adopted, a Constitution is demanded, together with liberty of conscience, liberty of the Press, liberty of speech, and liberty of education, besides an elective legislative assembly. This private conference was only held on Saturday, but by Monday the facts are known to the world and the ball has been set rolling which, under the leadership of a Slavonic Mirabeau or Lafs- yette, may lead to the ruin of militant auto- eracy throughout the Russian Empire:

At the same time, serious observers of the conditions of modern Russis, even among those who sympathise with the aspirations of the Russian people for a form of government which will give some legitimate scope for their ener gies, entertain grave doubts as to the capacity of the Russians for self-government. The mem- bers of the bureaucracy, indeed, base their claim to govern Russia, when they condescend to argue the matter at all; on the ground that acceptance of office the new Minister of the In- no other government is possible. Soon after his

terior made a mendorable declaration." Abroad," said Prince Sviatopolk Mirski, "people speak of a new Constitution for Russia: such a thing is, impossible under present conditions.". It is not only abroad that people speak of a new Constitu tion; it is in Russia itself that the demand is being did not stop short at a repetition of the common made. But Prince Sviatopolk-Mirski's declaration official formula. "But," he continued, "there is such a thing as local self-government, as is exemplified in the Zemstvos. I believe," he added, "in Zematvos." That is a declaration of immense importance coming from such a quarter how important is demonstrated, with singular appositeness in an article on "Self-government in Russia" in the new number of the Empirs Review. For reasons which may readily be sur mised, the writer of the article desires to pre- serve his anonymity; but internal evidence renders almost superfluous the editorial as surance that the writer is entitled to be listened to with respect when he seeks to supplement Prince Sviatopolk-Mirski's state- mont by giving a sketch of the Zemstvo institution in Russia. The evidence which THEOFPTIAN GASETTE IS PRINTED ON PAPER is adduced of the existence of the seeds of a representative system of government throughout the greater part of European

N.B-9ribecriptions commence trees the 1e or 10th of any month SUBSCRIPTIONS and ADVERTISEMENTS at dne la advices P. O. Orders and Thayer t be made payable to the Editor and Manager Bowland Snelling, Alexandria.

appears to have taken root in Russian provin cial life, the success which has on the whole attended it, and the possibilities which it presents of preparing the people for the difficult. task of self-government. The Zemstvo instita tion is a tiny plant, but if it be wisely tended it may yet grow into a noble tree. Unfortunately Prince Sviatopolk-Mirski's belief in the Zemst vos is not a common article of bureaucratic

A very interesting telegram from St. Peters-faith, and there have been indications that, if burg this morning announces that the Russian some of the bureaucrats of St. Petersburg Government actually gave permission for a could have their way' even this struggling public conference to be held at St. Peters experiment in local self government would be barg, composed of representativos of "Zems crashed beneath the heel of autocracy. But tvos" throughout the country. At the last the fact that the delegates of the Zemstvos moment, however, the courage of the autocracy Saturday last is an historical event of the were allowed, even to confer in private on failed, and the sanction for a public con utmost significance, and we may live to reckon ference was withdrawn, though the delegates November 19, 1904, as one of the cardinal were allowed to meet in privata A more dates in the history of the human race. portentous step. in the history of the poli tical emancipation of the human race has not occurred since the summoning of the States General. The analogy can be pressed

A stiff artillery fire was opened on the Russian right at daylight, and lasted for several hours. The fire continued at intervals during the day. The Russians are expecting a general attack. All ranges have been carefully marked, and whichever army attacks is likely to suffer severely.. (Reuter.)
MUXDEN, November 19. The Hussians expect a general attack. (H) ST. PETERSBURG, November 20 The Russian artillery on the Sha Ho have compelled the Japanese to fall back. (Havas.).

TOKIO, November 20. Friday's report from Marshal Oyama, detail- Fing the various skirmishes and stating that the Russian bombardment of the Japanese positions was resultless, seems to indicate the imminence of another great battle, though, apparently, neither side has yet made any decisive move- ment. The Russian feints were evidently (Reiter.)

TANZIM DEPARTMENT AND CAIRO. In our last issue we mentioned that the inhabitants of Helouan, weary of the absolute contempt with which the Tanzim, Department treated their just complaints, had determined to appeal directly to Lord Cromer. But it is

ST. PETERSBURG, November 20. The attack on Putiloff, mentioned on 18th inst., was made in order to ascertain the strength of the Russian position. The Japanese got within 30 yards of the trenches, but were finally repulsed leaving 100 dead. (Beuter.)
not. Helouan alone which suffers from the THE UNITED STATES.
neglect and indifference of the Tanzim Depart ment. Cairo has also grounds for complaint, and
it must be admitted that the maintenance of
the streets of the Capital is not carried out

with such a regard for the convenience of the THE PRESIDENTS MESSAGE. public as it would be only reasonable to expect. No one, who knows anything at all of the conditions of life in the city and of the always increasing flood of traffe that pours through its streets all day long, will deny that on the whole this work is well done, for though it might, we should imagine, be easily expedited when 'tis done, 'tis well done, but there is a want of tact in the choice of time and place for the labours of the department in charge that is not merely annoying to the
average man in the street, but a very serious
impediment to the business of the town. At the present moment Clot Bey street has been
It is understood that Mr. Roosevelt's message

pulled up from one end to the other and all will say nothing regarding tariff reform, but traffic throughout it is completely stopped. In the party leaders are carefully considering a fact this has been the case for more than a revision which will be proposed next year. month past, with the single qualification that the Tramway Company has continued to use its lines through the street. CLOT BEY STREET, Cairo, is now entirely blocked for the laying down of asphalt.”
QUARANTINE restrictions against arrivals in Egyptian ports from Salaya have been sup pressed.
AN INCENDIARY.The servant of Teufik Bey Abel el Kader, who is accused of setting his asters house on fire, at Shoubra, and there by causing loss and damage equivalent to L.Ez has been arfested.

ALEXANDRIA OPERA SEASON. The Italian opers company for the operatic season at the Zania Theatre, and Khedivial Opera House arrived at Alexandria trom Italy yesterday by the Fiorg Kufatto steamer. The first perform anos will take place at the Zazinia on Monday

LETTER TO THE EDITOR We do not hold ourselves

NILE BOILER EXPLOSION. TO THE EDITOR OF THE EGYPTIAN GARTE journal a few days ago of a boiler explosion, Dear Sir,-Having read in your esteemed. which occurred on a steamer lying near Kar el-Nil Bridge, Cairo, which resulted in the loss of several lives; I would like through the boilers and engines of river steamers are not medium of this paper to enquire why the put under compulsory inspection by the Pablic Works Department, seeing that boilet and engines on land- are under compulsory super vision of the Department. Zervudachi: After Mixed Tribunals, under the presidency of for official inspection of boilers and engines of The presents were both-costly and numerous all of Hellenic society was present. Dancing Affairs. engaged in repairing such steamers, that there Are a considerable number of steamers (if snols gems. they can be called) working on the Nile, that are, with respect to their boilers, a greater menage to those who are employed on them and to any craft that come near them, than any floating mine yet designed. The writer knows the existence of small craft on the Nile which are equipped with boilers the age of which must be sought for in the long-forgotten past. Surely our Government in Bapt can put their foot firmly down now and demand the compulsory inspection of these craft by competent and responsible officials.

SER W. WILLCOCKS EXPEDITION. mission from the Turkish Government to exa- As Sir William Willcocks has received per- mine into the ancient irrigation system on the Tigris and Euphrates, he is leaving to morrow for Bombay en route for Basra and Bagdad, where he hopes to make a preliminary examina tion of the ground this winter.

DEPARTURE OF FLEET andria, on the occasion of the departure of the Yesterday afternoon, the harbour of Alex- fleet, was the scene of unwonted movement and animation. Early in the afternoon large numbers of people collected on the quay and sailed out

THE BRIDAL PROCESSION. arrived and the scene, was animated, in the At 10 o'clock the guests had nearly all extreme. The uniforms of the officers of the Army of Occupation and of the naval officers of the Greek Squadron, the exquisite dresses of the ladies, and the general diversity of the gathering, contributed to make the spectacle most brilliant and entrancing. Il manquait à notre Municipalité, pour être complète, un corps de police spécial Cette lacune, à peine signalée, vient d'être comblée. Déjà la Délégation et le Gouver- norat se sont occupés da nombre et du salaire de ce noavesa personnel. Il ne reste plus qu'à soumettre la proposition à la La Banque Nationale atteint en clôture Commission Municipale. Quelles vont être les attributions de cette police indépen- 24 5/16, la Wardan 7 7/8, la Brasserie des dante, de cet Etat dans l'Etat, nous avons Pyramides 182, les Markets 27, les Eaux en soin de le demander. Si nos informa d'Alexandrie 16 15/16, les Eaux du Caire tions sont exsictes, ce corps est destiné à 1090, les Privilégiés Tramways 146 1/2 prêter main forte sax percepteurs munici-et les Dividendes 385. psax, en ce qui concerne en particulier Is Saxe du 20/0. Cet impôt que le contribu- able sisé paie sans difficulté, le pauvre est obligé quelquefois de le refuser. C'est à quoi va servir la nouvelle police. Les dé
bria de meubles de es malheureux seront vendus séance tenante et toutes les mesures de rigueur qui sont permises par la loi, impitoyablement appliquées.
Après avoir décroché de nouveau le prix de 40, la Salt & Sods est retombée in elóture à 39/6.
La Bébéra fléchit légèrement à 56, les Press Libres à 28 1/2, l'Anglo-American
Nile à 5 1/4, et la Delta Light à 15 5/16.

Nous connaissons trop malheureusement les tendances de nos conseillers pour douter un moment qu'ils ne snetionnent Is me- sure proposé par la Délégation. Ils ont tonjours déployé beaucoup de cèl pour la perception des impôs et s'ils avaient montré la même rigu ur dans l'adminis- tration des dépenses, ils ne mériteraient que des éloges.

Les porteurs d'actions devront, pour prendre part à l'assemblée, déposer leurs actions 3 jours au moins avant la réunion dans une des Banques ci-après désignées au Caire ou à Alexandrie.
National Bank of Egypt, Crédit Lyon nais, Anglo-Egyptian Bank Ld., Banque Impétale Ottomane, Bank of Egypt Ld, on an Siège de la Compagnie à Liverpool, 17, Sweeting Street.
